intro: Leptanthus peruvianus, commonly known as the Peruvian velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, velvety leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially grown.
